poem:
### The Illustrated Lyrics

In the soft morning light, a father turns pages,  
his son tracing images with a patient finger.  
Eyeless forms speak volumes beyond the notes,  
a trombone mouth opens the realm of possibility.  
The Beatles in technicolor whispers,  
binding a father and son with unplayed songs,  
music found between lines,  
notes on the silent stave of their togetherness.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Maybe I’m Amazed by John Harris review – a father and his autistic son bond through music One of my favourite books growing up was my dad’s copy of The Beatles Illustrated Lyrics. I spent hours flicking through images of an eyeless, trombone-mouthed golden man swallowing naked bodies, and a full-page, black-and-white comic strip by legendary psychedelic artist Rick Griffin. It didn’t matter that I hadn’t yet listened to most of the songs – the surreal visual riffs felt". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
